content.description: One of the hardest established routes at the Homestead. Only one known assent to date.
content.location: To the right of Fred's Route and left of Black Sunshine

climbs.name: Way 'Stead
climbs.fa: Luke Anaya, Brent Bingham, Larry, Zach Anaya

content.description:
Fun and hard tufa pulling.  The first twenty feet are nothing special, but the following thirty feet are great.  Really fun movement over cool features.  Crux is at the top. 

  Unfortunately, the last bolt is in a less than favorable spot.  I would have placed the bolt closer to the clipping stance, but the rock was very hollow sounding when tapping it with my hammer.  I even went as far as to drill a hole where I wanted the bolt and got nothing but dust, no rock.  I placed it in the closest solid stone.  The clip adds a little inconvenience, but at least it is safe.
content.location: It is the last route on the right side of Tufa City before you get to the rope access that leads to Tufa Yard Dash and the other routes at that ledge.

content.description: Very steep short route.  Short section of Tufa to mail slots to a ragged hole then over a roof and up dihedral.  A jug haul to really hard moves to get established in the corner.  Would only do it if you have done a ton of other things and you need a little late day entertainment.
content.location: Just left of Couples Fear Factor.

content.description: Easier moves to get to the low roof. Clip bolt just over the lip from underneath the roof. Here is the crux pull a few hard moves, starting with tufa/pockets then slopey opened handed holds. Then pulling the hardest moves on the route to get established on one of the giant tufas. Clip two bolts on left side of tufa while using holds on the right side of the tufa. One more move just as the tufa disappears then easy terrain to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2 chain anchor. 3rd bolt has a fixed chain draw.
content.location: First route to the right of Way'Stead. Starts on upper tier. Access start via same way as Tufa King and TYD.

content.description: Huge tufa holds everywhere.
content.location: This route is located at the far right side of Tufa City just prior to Marley Wall.  Between TYD and JMM

content.description:
DO NOT CLIMB ON TUFAS AFTER HEAVY RAINS OR IF THE WALL APPEARS WET! Tufas are very fragile and break really easily when wet. Don't ruin climbs for everyone else!*  

  The largest single climbable tufa at the Homestead.  Climb up HUGE tufa / face to inverted buckets to anchors.  Amazing climb!
content.location: This route is located at the far right side of Tufa City just prior to Marley Wall.  Base of the climb is 20 feet up the wall, fixed rope access.  It is the second of the four routes (from left to right) at this belay station.

content.description: Climbs the first 3 bolts of Dead Sea then moves right on the ledge.  A body length higher on the next ledge most will reach down and unclip the bolt to reduce rope drag or you can use longer draws on the 3rd and 4th bolts.  Gets really interesting after the half way point when one begins climbing a light colored tufa.  It stays in your face all the way to the anchors.  A little grungy in the middle with a move to a flake that looks really scary but is quite solid.
content.location: Same as Dead Sea which is about 100 feet right of the rock wall/cave area.  Big boulders against the wall here.

content.description: Face moves to tufa to hard boulder move at the top.
content.location: Just right of Ground Affects.

content.description:
Good tufa climbing leads you up to a huge rest just before the line becomes inverted and the crux.  From here it is all business.  Pull this hard crux move and continue through the still challenging head wall to the anchors.   

  Greg Varela bolted this line.
content.protection: 3 additional bolts past the anchors (total of 13 for entire route, including the mid-anchors.  Very top has two chain anchor with biners
content.location: This route is located at the far right side of Tufa City just prior to Marley Wall. Base of the climb is 20 feet up the wall, fixed rope access. Leftmost route of the four at this belay station.

content.description: Great tufa climbing leads to the big rest hueco under the roof where you can clip the anchors and swing out into space, or continue on up through the roof for the full line Tufa King Swole!
content.location: Immediately to the left of Tufa Yard Dash. This is the 1st set of anchors of Tufa King Swole.  Beware that there is a large hole just down and left of the anchors that has an active bee hive.  Depending on season and conditions, they may be swarming.

content.description: Extension of Microburst.  Take the rest at end of Microburst, then fire up through some harder moves and 4 or so more bolts to the second set of anchors.
content.location: Extension of Microburst

content.description:
Steep start with a large hueco-like hole, pull the first roof onto paralleling tufa's up to a second smaller roof. Fun climbing on great rock leads to a higher pump crux followed by a jug haul finish to the anchors.   

  A 60 meter rope is more than enough to climb this route and lower back to the Balcony(where the route starts).  A 70 meter rope will reach from the balcony to the anchors and all the way to the ground.  70m is NOT long enough for both ends to reach the ground from the anchor.  When using a 60 meter rope make sure to only lower the climber to the balcony and not the ground.
content.location: The first and currently the only route up on the Tufa Balcony.  Solar Delirium is located directly above Spicy Crispy.  The Balcony spans roughly from above La Linea Negra to above Flying Cocksman.  You can access the balcony by climbing and topping out any of the eight routes located under it. Except for Short and Stiff, it's too short.  The easiest route would probably be Rain Day followed by Couples Fear Factor.  There is a Via Ferrata along the balcony for safety and a two bolt anchor in the middle to belay up a second and for repelling.

content.description: Climb past tufas and cool flowstone features to reach a 4' roof. Powerful moves will lead past this feature to a perplexing and difficult traverse leading right to the high blocky arete. Follow arete to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains. The first bolt is as low as the rock allows. Easy to reach but use a stick clip if you are uncomfortable.To avoid a long right to left swinging fall at the crux (b/w bolts 4/5), a long sling is recommended for bolt 5.  This will allow you to clip from the crimps on the popcorn face.
content.location: Starts 15 feet right of Couples Fear Factor.

content.description: Tufa climbing to fun easier 5.10 climbing with a crux at the top.   Climb 3 bolts to start getting into the tufas. Pull a few moves to get where the Tufa crux is. Make a large move through a blank section to a popcorn sloper. Mantle the lip and traverse right. Then head up the cool terrain of easier climbing. Clip the last bolt and prepare for the final crux section. Cross over to a blocky hold, set up and make a big move to an ok hold a big shoulder move then the jug lip just above the chains.
content.protection: 19 Bolts. There are two leaver chain draws for the traverse. Be sure to back clean at least one. There is a leaver biner for the 4th bolt so that when you are cleaning it you don't lower into the Saguaro.
content.location: First route to the right of Flying Cocksman.

content.description: A few easy slab moves lead to some really fun and powerful sequences on tufas and other unique holds.  Yeah, it's not very long.
content.location: Just to the right of Couples Fear Factor, and just to the left of Spicy Crispy

content.description: Difficult to read crux.
content.location: furthest route left at Tufa City

content.description: This is a short, bouldery route that packs a punch in its 24 total moves.  The first 14 moves or so are 5.11c/d and will have you sidepulling and underclinging your way to a 10 move boulder problem (V7 maybe?).  Heel hook and use the little runnel hold to establish yourself underneath the small roof.  From here you have 4 nails hard moves that culminate with a deadpoint to the finishing jug.  Fun climb that hasn't seemed to get much traffic over the years.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with biners.  Long draw (18" or so) recommended for bolt #5.
content.location: Between Tufa the Soul and Calcite Cruiser.

content.description: Climbs left of Tufa King to the first set of chain anchors. All of the business is from bolts 2-4.  Pinches, sidepulls, and underclings will get you to a good rest around bolt 5.  From here move right then straight up or 2 bolts or so, before going up and left for the final moves.  Don't underestimate the pump on this one.  The last 3-4 holds are very positive but can feel bad on pumped arms.  Recommendations:  Belay from the lower level, left side of the palo verde.  Bring up a stick and pre-clip bolts 1 & 3.  Belayer should give a soft catch to ensure the climber clears the roof on a fall.  Beware: I don't think this route has seen much action, as it is still very much shedding rock.  Be careful as the climber and wear a helmet as a belayer.  Note: There is a bolted extension thought to go at around 13b, unclear if that has been sent.
content.location: 1st line left of Tufa King, and right of Tufa Size me

content.description: Scramble up to and climb the tufa to a block, then pass a sloper, large crimps and end on the lyback.    Just like the route to the left and the six routes to the right, this routes ends half way up the wall just before a large ledge (balcony).
content.location: Just to the right of LLN, just left of Grip it and Rip it.

content.description: Good and difficult line. Doesn't see much traffic.
content.location: At the left side of Tufa City is a built up rock sun shelter wall.  This route starts all the way back behind the sun wall. Just left of Fred's Route.

content.description: Extension to Fred's Route.  Hard moves right after the midway anchors using underclings and tufa pinches.  Once above you get some bigger holds and a short rest.  The RP crux comes between bolts 7-8.  Bad right hand undercling to a left hand sloper, stab to a right hand gaston crimp.  Pop up and left to a slopey rail and make sure to leave room for your right hand.  A few more moves take you up and left onto a blocky protrusion that takes you to the anchors.  Note: Blowing bolt 8 (2nd bolt after the midway chains) will result in a long(ish) right to left fall, narrowly missing a tufa, and slamming your feet into the wall.  Not a bad idea to use a long sling on bolt 8, at least while you are working the route.
content.protection: 11 bolts to chain anchors with biners
content.location: This is the 5 bolt extension to Fred's Route

content.description:
Pull off the ground on nice jugs and head up the clean white face above.  While the angle isn't real steep there are some engaging moves between tufa's and other cool holds.  There are a few cruxes so rest well when the opportunity arises. 

  Fun route and solid at 11d.
content.location: On the Main Part of Tufa City Wall.  Starts just right of a large boulder.  The the Left is Sun Burst and to the right is Canned Heat.

content.description:
Unlike the other steep tufa routes this one requires more delicate climbing up small insecure holds. 

  Climb up onto a boulder and cover some easy ground to the first bolt.  Quickly the climbing becomes balancy and tough to read.  Continue up getting the occasional "great" hold to some large rest huecos.  Rest here a make a few cool layback moves to the mid anchors. 

  After the Mid Anchors the climbing changes dramatically to overhanging slopers.  Pull a hard boulder problem V5? and continue up another 3 bolts to send Sun Burst 13a
content.location: Between Tufa Tussle and Millenium Meltdown.  Starts above a large boulder blocking the trail.

content.description: A crimpy route up a black streak that turns into a small and rounded tufa.
content.location: This route is to the right of the main tufu city area.

content.description: Hard route, doesn't see much traffic.
content.protection: 9 bolts + one perma + clip ins, you'll want to extend the first draw in the tufas at least
content.location: First route to the left of the rock sun shelter wall at the start of Tufa City.

content.description: Fun moves on big tufa holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts to biner.  Best not to lower off the biners at this time as they will coil your rope.  They anchor could use some quick links between the hangers and the biners as of 1-10-10.
content.location: This route is located at the far right side of Tufa City just prior to Marley Wall. Base of the climb is 20 feet up the wall, fixed rope access. Furthest route to the right.  It is the last route on Tufa City.

content.description: Three Cruxes on this one and pretty sustained to the anchors as well as a no hands rest. Stout moves low and above the no hands rest where the bee hive is. Stellar tufa pinching near the end.
content.location: Left of Cry a Little Send a Little.

content.description: The finish on tufas is really fun.  The pods are friendlier than they appear.  It is short and fun.
content.location: Stay below the tier at the beginning of Finland.  As the wall curves around to the right you will find a stone wall built by climbers.  The route is about 20 feet to the right.  It is distinguished by some ragged looking pods, and you don't need a stick to clip the first bolt.

content.description: Pockets, tufas, jugs and steep rock.  You will only wish it was longer.
content.location: Just left of Via Ferrari which is just left of Couples Fear Factor.

content.description:
Stickclip the first bolt and make some tricky moves up the blocky pumpy start. Rest up on the convenient ledge and pull Tufa moves over the steep bulge.  Here the 5th bolt is placed far right and difficult to spot.  Continue up on cool easy tufa moves to the anchors.  

  This is the first half of the 13b Nambla, so if feeling strong continue up another 5 bolts for the 13b tick.
content.location: Starts above the pile of stacked boulders making up the "shade cave"  In between the routes The Natural and Almighty, 2 hard 13's

content.description: Fun moves through crazy features lead to a cruxy dihedral just before a 6 foot roof. After the roof, one more big crank is rewarded with easier climbing and nice exposure.
content.protection: 6 bolts (all orange hangers) to metolius rap hangers. SPECIAL PRECAUTION: when cleaning the route, do not swing out from below the third bolt or you may have a close encounter with a large cactus! The first bolt can be cleaned from the ledge. (edit) It would appear that lightning has removed the large saguaro so this is not an issue any more.
content.location: 10 feet right of Spicy Crispy.

content.description: Climb up a white dihedral to an overhanging headwall.
content.location: This climb is to the right of the "cave" just right of a tree.

climbs.name: Cry a Little Send a Little

content.description: This is a great route that I walked by for years as it just didn't look like there was enough climbing to make it worth the effort. What a blast this turned out to be. Start on a popcorn covered slab and angle left to a short section of slightly overhanging tufa climbing that has great holds, movement and flow. The steep face takes you to a corner system that looks like you could do with no hands. Despite easing considerably we didn't feel like we were slogging higher just to make the climb longer. The easiest climb at Tufa City and a great warm up for Couples... Tufa Yard Dash or any of the elevens. My guess is that by next year this will have as much chalk on it as any of the classics. To be fair about the grade, we did this over the two days we were there. We climbed at Rough Rider all morning then as this side of the canyon got shade we hiked over to stay in the shade and climbed more. Then we set this up with the last two hours of light. We both found ourselves pretty pumped at the end of the steep crux section (could be we were tired from all the other routes we had done) but we had already climbed all day so we thought it is probably 5.10 but it could be a tad harder. If you don't enjoy the movement and holds on this I will be surprised.
content.location: Walk past the boulders at the base of Dead Sea, Tufa Tussle and Micro Burst. The route starts to the Left of La Linea Negra on the popcorn covered slab.

content.description: Start up an easy short sharp bulge to an easy slab.  Run up a cool tufa system, that gets progressively more overhanging.  Carefully climb past some fragile large tufa's to large huecos.  Rest here and pull the final steep moves to a nice rest and easy finish.
content.location: Towards the end of Tufa City.  Between the routes "Via Ferrari" and "Short & Stiff".  Look for the double tufa system starting up the slab, to an overhang.

content.description: This fun line was probably the best warmup in the Tufa City area.  Now John's Meat Market might make the best warmup.  Engaging climbing on cool holds and is quite a bit longer than the other moderate routes.
content.location: Main Part of Tufa City, Second route past a large boulder.  To the left is Millenium Meltdown, to the right is La Linea Negra.

content.description: Starts behind a huge Palo Verde bush/tree. Follow cool tufa and hueco features to fun face climbing on small holds.
content.location: Just to the left of Dead Sea.

content.description: A good length single pitch sport route with fun movement and some tufas. This route sports a huge sit down rest cave a little more than half way up the route.  Continues out of cave left then climbs right over cave on head wall.
content.location: Two routes to the right of the built rock sun shelter wall.  Just to the left of Ground Affects.

content.description: This is the orange and black streaked wall you can see driving in when you are at the second gate.  This wall curves from east facing to south facing.  The area called Tufa City starts more or less near the apex of the curve.  The rock is good and the Tufa routes are fun.  Climb fall to spring and later if you love the heat.  The afternoon is a good time to be on this wall unless it is cold.
